commit_list.message:
In smpiff/smpif90 program, make -o consume the next argument.

Else, when used for example in preprocessor mode, the output
file, name something.f would be interpreted as an input file
by the argument parsing loop.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message: Really remove (commented) alternative method of resolve_member()
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message:
Sanitize the rest of dwarf operation regarding stack popping.

In all those cases, the order of pop() was not an issue since
the operations were commutatives, but those could give bad
ideas for other cases.

commit_list.message: Comment not working code in resolve_member() (before permanent removal?)

commit_list.message:
Fix an undefined C behavior.

This will fix the minus operation on certain OS/compilers.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message: Check that scope is non-NULL pointer.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message:
Two variables must be defined without using cmakedefine macros.

They have values other than 0|1, mea culpa...
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message:
Use the CMake macro #cmakedefine01 in configurable files.

cmakedefine01 allows to perform C preprocessor replacements
that define a variable to 0 or 1 when configure_file is called,
instead of (not) defining the variable (see
https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v2.8.8/cmake.html#command:configure_file
for the 2.8.8 doc).

This ease the defining of config.h variables (no foreach loops
that preset them to 0), but two requirements must be met:
 1. variable name must match in cmake and config.h.in
 2. no comment on the macro line
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message:
Switch the event handling in the MC to libevent.

This is a good alternative to provide a clean socket/signal
handling, which allows to finaly enable the MC on FreeBSD too. The
downside is that now libevent>=2 is necessary to build the model
checker.

Thanks to degomme@ for the mentoring ;)
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message:
Add more libraries to blacklist.

FreeBSD system and LLVM related libraries.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message: BSD/SysV ptrace resume addr is 1, not 0 like in linux.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message:
More ptrace portability in model checker.

No PTRACE_O_TRACEEXIT equivalent in the original ptrace API, futher
work will indicate if this will be a problem.

Update message a bit when neither linux's or BSD's version are
available.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message:
Mark shared libraries private clean pages as non-writable on FreeBSD.

This is how persmissions are with Linux, and later simgrid identifies
mappings based on path and permissions, so the less restistance path
is to present things more linux-like.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message: In FreeBSD map backend, mark stack same as in Linux
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message:
Add support to retrieve FreeBSD ucontext registers.

Sadly, no universal method as it depend on the CPU and the system
is free to implement whatever storage it see fit. Leave a terminating
error message for the next system to get ported.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message:
Add alternative to remap() in PageStore when not available.

Code is a bit simplistic, having way to expand mappings but not
shrink them (so leaving them as they are), but it does the job.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message: Set waitpid() for model-checked flags according to platform.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message:
Bump mmorecore buffer size to 256 bytes on FreeBSD

It seems to need more memory than Linux.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message:
When mmap-ing, ensute that offset is set to 0 if anon mmap

Linux tolerate non-zero offset parameter (and ignore it),
but others do not.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message:
Check for a dlfunc() function to get handle if present

dlfunc() is a (for now) FreeBSD-only function that is to be used when
trying to retrieve function handles from code segments, rather
than dlsym(), but let's make the code generic in case somebody else
likes the idea...
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message: Allow to use BSD ptrace().
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message: Build ID are somewhat gnu/linux specific.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message:
Make simgrid::mc::HeapLocation instanciation C++11 compliant

simgrid::mc::HeapLocation is a typedef of std:array which require use
of double brace to declare subobjects.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message: Use BYTE_ORDER macro, not private __BYTE_ORDER
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message: MADV_MERGEABLE is available on linux, guard it.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message: Use MAP_PREFAULT_READ on FreeBSD as en equivalent to MAP_POPULATE.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message:
Add -Wno-extern-c-compat when building with clang

Else it triggers an warning due to libunwind.h using empty C structures that
are turned into an error by -Werror.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message:
Add support for flang and ifort Fortran compilers.

Require to properly set flags/libs in the wrappers.
Tested with flang under FreeBSD and ifort under Linux.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message: Only use -Wno-format-nonliteral if compiler is GCC or Clang.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message: Define worker_function more rigourously to xbt_main_func_t.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message:
Handle some litteral string -> char* casts.

It's 100% legit in C, but icc seems to process it like C++, and
since simgrid is being ported to C++, well...
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message:
Use FindThreads to check for pthreading

It will prefer using threading as library if possible, and fallback
on -pthread only if necessary, which some compilers/systems
do not support anymore.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message:
Flush output of energy tests.

That'll ensure in order output.
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message: Use unsigned int for std:*map positions (must be >0).
commit_list.repo_description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)

commit_list.message:
CMake: switch to standard FindThreads.cmake module

It offers much cleaner output on systems/compilers
that do not support -pthread argument anymore
(thus allowing to better catch relevant warnings),
such as OSX.

commit_list.message:
Do not export default profile color tables

They are very big (120ko on a Pentax K-S1 DNG file) and would exceed
what can be stored in Exif, and serve no purpose as exported image have
been applied with a color profile.
commit_list.repo_description: darktable is an open source photography workflow application and raw developer

When reading exif, ensure that initialy, the buffer ptr is NULL, and ensure
it will be freed and reset to NULL if there is an error during the call.

commit_list.repo_description: darktable is an open source photography workflow application and raw developer

commit_list.message:
Change how Exif buffers are managed: since we could have buffer of length
>= 65356 bytes when adding new tags, allocate them with malloc() and let them
be returned by the read function. Then, in the jpeg format, remove the test
and let exiv2 manage things: it will display a nice help message if data
is too big to fit.

They have values other than 0|1, mea culpa...

Use the CMake macro #cmakedefine01 in configurable files.

cmakedefine01 allows to perform C preprocessor replacements
that define a variable to 0 or 1 when configure_file is called,
instead of (not) defining the variable (see
https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v2.8.8/cmake.html#command:configure_file
for the 2.8.8 doc).

This ease the defining of config.h variables (no foreach loops
that preset them to 0), but two requirements must be met:
 1. variable name must match in cmake and config.h.in
 2. no comment on the macro line

Switch the event handling in the MC to libevent.

This is a good alternative to provide a clean socket/signal
handling, which allows to finaly enable the MC on FreeBSD too. The
downside is that now libevent>=2 is necessary to build the model
checker.

Thanks to degomme@ for the mentoring ;)

Add more libraries to blacklist.

FreeBSD system and LLVM related libraries.
BSD/SysV ptrace resume addr is 1, not 0 like in linux.

More ptrace portability in model checker.

No PTRACE_O_TRACEEXIT equivalent in the original ptrace API, futher
work will indicate if this will be a problem.

Update message a bit when neither linux's or BSD's version are
available.

Mark shared libraries private clean pages as non-writable on FreeBSD.

This is how persmissions are with Linux, and later simgrid identifies
mappings based on path and permissions, so the less restistance path
is to present things more linux-like.
In FreeBSD map backend, mark stack same as in Linux

Add support to retrieve FreeBSD ucontext registers.

Sadly, no universal method as it depend on the CPU and the system
is free to implement whatever storage it see fit. Leave a terminating
error message for the next system to get ported.

Add alternative to remap() in PageStore when not available.

Code is a bit simplistic, having way to expand mappings but not
shrink them (so leaving them as they are), but it does the job.
Set waitpid() for model-checked flags according to platform.

Bump mmorecore buffer size to 256 bytes on FreeBSD

It seems to need more memory than Linux.

When mmap-ing, ensute that offset is set to 0 if anon mmap

Linux tolerate non-zero offset parameter (and ignore it),
but others do not.

Check for a dlfunc() function to get handle if present

dlfunc() is a (for now) FreeBSD-only function that is to be used when
trying to retrieve function handles from code segments, rather
than dlsym(), but let's make the code generic in case somebody else
likes the idea...
Allow to use BSD ptrace().
Build ID are somewhat gnu/linux specific.

Make simgrid::mc::HeapLocation instanciation C++11 compliant

simgrid::mc::HeapLocation is a typedef of std:array which require use
of double brace to declare subobjects.
Use BYTE_ORDER macro, not private __BYTE_ORDER
MADV_MERGEABLE is available on linux, guard it.
Use MAP_PREFAULT_READ on FreeBSD as en equivalent to MAP_POPULATE.

Add -Wno-extern-c-compat when building with clang

Else it triggers an warning due to libunwind.h using empty C structures that
are turned into an error by -Werror.
Now, input are managed in the MPIC formalism.
Mask crc computation result to ensure correct range value.

Reproject images for quicklooking

The portal do not display correctly UTM projected images.

Import gdal example script gdalcopyproj to transfert georeferencing.

Fix an issue where projection would be erased by ignoring GCPs.
Bundle a static ffmpeg copy with the service.
Call clean before install, declare phony targets.
Call ffmpeg from PATH.
Georeference quicklooks in EPSG:3857
If no band name provided in metadata, display a Band_<number> string.
Add support to produce gif & mp4 files as output.
Update comment about reprojection, and fix typo in wkt.

Get back to reprojecting quicklook into lonlat & wgs84.

Google webproj spec is actually to have files in WGS84, and
display them on webmercator.
Center min/max on zero and add colorbar.
Use new program path, built on GEP with gcc 4.7
Move fake input file to /data so that /application can be reset.

Get info to put into the RSC from converted files.

That'll help if resize are needed.
Set job timeout to 5h.
Replace some description placeholders by more meaningful text.
Be more verbose in log, that may help in some debug cases.
Clean up LN_DATA after invers_pixel, we need the space.
Instead of using abs path for utils, update PATH at begining.
Annotate quicklook with date.
Add new parameters to invers_pixel input file.
Embryonic README.
Remove crop as test, but lect_depl_cumule_lin must be disabled (temp?)
Remove *2 factor that was erroneous when scaling displacement.
Implement median removal from correlation maps.
Cloud_thresh is a micmac job parameter.
Move cloud_thres param to job params.
Update publication reference to markdown (and not rst)
Fix typo in publication block.
No markdown for citation.

Update reference to original publication.
Publish deplacement & RMS tiffs.
Set cloud threshold as parameter.
Use the water vapor layer to filter images too cloudy.

In case of downloading error, do not hard abort, just let this date
goooo
Merge branch 'do_correl' of https://github.com/geohazards-tep/dcs-isterre-tio into do_correl
Empty the default input fields.
Improve README with better reference to publication.

Fix displacement measurement value, increase number of pairs to 4 per
date.
Deactivate dequant, results are not worth the computation time.

Only downscale to half resolution for quicklook, people still
want to have some insight.

Use the same correlation parameters as MPIC, they give really good
results!

Tune Micmac output, begining by setting CorrelMin=0.0

This was done by reworking how the command is actually
called, and a custom XML file.
Move gdal scripts to gdal subdir, add gdal_calc.py
Limit number of correl, crude test on cloud cover.
Disable weighting displacement maps with correl for now.
Change the way dates are sorted, and eliminate empty images.
Guard with brackets patterns such as $date.tiff
Remove aux script from packaging.
Basic micmac node is now working.
Set ciop.job.max.tasks for micmac job, fix sample sources.
Import workflow skeletton that could process input directly.
Add small script to remove median from dataset.
Use micmac from RPM.
Bump NSBAS version to 0.1853.
Add a target to retrieve the RPMS sources.

Revert to r1829 of NSBAS.

Push correlation score results to next job.
When we look at the available files to determine dates, do not use CC

In case we cover multiple UTM zones and there is resampling,
we do NOT want nearest neighbour.
